reviews.text: Stayed here to visit with friends in Arlington but also to visit D.C. Perfect location right by the metro so easy to commute to places. The lobby was very nice with a fireplace and a sitting area. Breakfast was a hot breakfast with a lot of variety in the mornings. The room was a suite style with a living area and full kitchenette. Bed was comfortable and the bathroom had granite countertops. The couch in the sitting area was a pull out sleeper sofa so the room would be perfect if traveling with kids. Restaurants all around within walking distance. The property looks like it is a newer property- no signs of wear anywhere that I saw. Very clean. They must allow pets as I saw a couple of people with their dog going on the elevator.
reviews.title: Loved the location

reviews.text: All four of us enjoyed our stay at this hotel in a 1 bedroom king suite with a pull out sofa. The sofa bed was so-so, while the king bed was much more confortable. The room was clean and large enough for our group. The kitchen was great for heating up leftovers and storing food/drink. We always had enough towels for the bathroom and liked that the sink was separate from the shower/toilet. We couldn't figure out the cooling system in the room...it was downright cold below 73 degrees, but upon turning the system up to 74 degrees, the heater came on! We called maintenance once to address the loose handle on the toilet and they fixed it promptly. We ate at the complimentary breakfast buffet most mornings during our 4 night stay which is a plus when on a budget. My son utilized the indoor pool twice during downtime from the day's activities. There are countless restaurants, coffee spots, and shops within walking distance of the hotel. As others have stated, the metro is close to the hotel for our main form of transportation into DC...short ride to all tourist areas. We even took the metro from DCA to the Courthouse metro station...easy and less than a taxi ride to get to the hotel. Finally, the hotel staff was friendly and always willing to give us suggestions on area restaurants or anything else we requested. Overall, a quality hotel in a great area just outside of DC!
reviews.title: Quality hotel close to DC sites

reviews.text: After seeing the prices for two rooms in DC, we chose to get the two-bedroom suite at the Residence Inn in Arlington instead. One king bed in a private bedroom with bathroom, one queen bed in a private bedroom with bathroom, then a pull-out sofa. The sofa also has a large one piece cushion - my 20 year old sons used the sofa and the cushion and let their sister have the queen bedroom. Small four seat dining table with ethernet at the edge for the computers. Wi-fi was spotty so it was great having the ethernet. The kitchen was clean and basic utensils; very nice for a four day stay.
reviews.title: Comfortable for a Family of Five Adults

reviews.text: The breakfast was great - hot choices daily, fruit, cereals, oatmeal, the ubiquitos waffle maker, etc.
reviews.title: Gem in Arlington!

reviews.text: It was a very short five to ten minute walk to the Courthouse Metro station through a nice office complex.
reviews.title: Best hotel from top to bottom

reviews.text: Close to metro, great location, great rooms... Highly recommend!
reviews.title: Great family hotel for DC visit

reviews.text: My wife and I stayed here and were very happy with our stay. Front desk personnel were very friendly and explained all the facillities and amenities. You will not be disappointed staying here.
reviews.title: Great location, hospitality, super neat and clean

reviews.text: We stayed here for three weeks while relocating. We had a suite with 2 brms and small kitchenette, living room area. It is hard to put my finger on why I did not like this place much, afterall included is: free breakfasts, good gym, pool, clean laundry room, etc. But somehow it is missing something; it felt impersonal, decor is like walking into Marshals store, there are free meals 2-3 times a week which I found almost inedible- overcooked, tasteless mass produced gruel. The breakfast is fine but little variation from week to week. The location is good near metro, restaurants and movies. Staff were also friendly and professional. In summary, fine for a short stay but don't overstay!
reviews.title: Very functional but charmless

reviews.text: I was looking at a long stay in Northern Virginia and was happy I got a room at the RI Arlington Courthouse. The hotel is brand new, which means everything is in great working order, clean, and in good repair.
reviews.title: Excellent location, nice hotel

reviews.text: To start with the location cannot be beat. The Metro is very close, and was great for business or pleasure outings. There are a number of great restaurants (chains and independents) within a mile of the hotel, and a Safeway and Whole Foods each about a 1/2 mile away (in opposite directions). For running, the streets are safe and populated with like-minded people. The area is all hills, but that just makes you stronger. I found a nice loop to the Marine Memorial (Iwo Jima Memorial) that was about 2.8 miles.
reviews.title: Great Property Right Outside of DC

reviews.text: Loved it could move in!
reviews.title: Great hotel !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great room
reviews.title: WOW!!!

reviews.text: Great breakfast
reviews.title: What a fabulous hotel!

reviews.text: Great location
reviews.title: Top of the Line and it shows

reviews.text: WOW! This HAS to be the nicest Residence Inn I've ever stayed in! Very modern and updated furnishings, and the largest breakfast buffet I've ever seen at a Residence Inn! You can park right around the corner at the lot for the mall (free on Sundays and holidays!) and save on parking. Lots of restaurants within walking distance....and very close to the Metro. Travel quite frequently to DC for a weekend getaway, and would definitely stay here again!
reviews.title: Fantastic Residence Inn-- new, clean, great location!
